## Description {#details}

&#39;&#123; a, b, c &#125;&#39; - Represents an initializer for a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitsrecty">BitsRecTy</a> value.

It contains a vector of bits, whose size is determined by the type.

Definition at line 587 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h">Record.h</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h/#l00623">623</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h">Record.h</a>.

### convertInitializerBitRange() {#aa2c02786149c8b64a7047e8ad20209e5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const Init &#42; BitsInit::convertInitializerBitRange (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; unsigned &gt; Bits) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This function is used to implement the bit range selection operator.

Given a value, it selects the specified bits, returning them as a new <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/init">Init</a></code> of type <code>bits</code>. If it is not legal to use the bit selection operator on this value, null is returned.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h/#l00614">614</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h">Record.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/record-cpp/#l00523">523</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/record-cpp">Record.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### convertInitializerTo() {#ac88ed97cdf23651423069ebc764ce6bf}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const Init &#42; BitsInit::convertInitializerTo (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/recty">RecTy</a> &#42; Ty) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Convert to a value whose type is <code>Ty</code>, or return null if this is not possible.

This can happen if the value&#39;s type is convertible to <code>Ty</code>, but there are unresolved references.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h/#l00612">612</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h">Record.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/record-cpp/#l00490">490</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/record-cpp">Record.cpp</a>.

Is this a concrete and fully resolved value without any references or stuck operations?

Unset values are concrete.

### resolveReferences() {#ac80663dd5a98becc34254b6f72fc0339}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const Init &#42; BitsInit::resolveReferences (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/resolver">Resolver</a> &amp; R) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This function is used by classes that refer to other variables which may not be defined at the time the expression is formed.

If a value is set for the variable later, this method will be called on users of the value to allow the value to propagate out.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h/#l00632">632</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h">Record.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/record-cpp/#l00556">556</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/record-cpp">Record.cpp</a>.
